get.description:
Aruba Virtual Switching Extension (VSX).
VSX is a link aggregation technique, where two or more links across two
switches are aggregated together to form a LAG which will act as a single
logical interface. The IEEE standard 802.3ad, is limited to aggregating
links on a single switch or device. The Virtual Switching Extension (VSX)
feature uses a new proprietary technology to overcome this limitation and
supports link aggregation for the links spanning across multiple switches in
the same VRF. The two switches are connected through an inter switch link (ISL).
VSX provides node-level redundancy in a network when one of the switches fails.
The downstream device is configured as a 802.3ad LAG interface. Though the LAG is
connected to two separate devices they are seen as a single device. The downstream
devices can be any device that supports 802.3ad. In VSX, one device acts as primary
and the other device acts as secondary.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaVsx_VsxProfilesSchema.description:
Aruba Virtual Switching Extension (VSX).
VSX is a link aggregation technique, where two or more links across two
switches are aggregated together to form a LAG which will act as a single
logical interface. The IEEE standard 802.3ad, is limited to aggregating
links on a single switch or device. The Virtual Switching Extension (VSX)
feature uses a new proprietary technology to overcome this limitation and
supports link aggregation for the links spanning across multiple switches in
the same VRF. The two switches are connected through an inter switch link (ISL).
VSX provides node-level redundancy in a network when one of the switches fails.
The downstream device is configured as a 802.3ad LAG interface. Though the LAG is
connected to two separate devices they are seen as a single device. The downstream
devices can be any device that supports 802.3ad. In VSX, one device acts as primary
and the other device acts as secondary.

auto-role.description:
Determines if the role selection is automatic.
When it is automatic, peers with same model, primary will be the one with lowest mac-address.
In different models, primary will be the one with highest model/sku

peer1.description: VSX configuration for the primary device for this profile.

peer2.description: VSX configuration for the secondary device of this profile.

sync-features.description: VSX configuration that syncs to both primary and secondary.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

auto-role.description:
Determines if the role selection is automatic.
When it is automatic, peers with same model, primary will be the one with lowest mac-address.
In different models, primary will be the one with highest model/sku

peer1.description: VSX configuration for the primary device for this profile.

peer2.description: VSX configuration for the secondary device of this profile.

sync-features.description: VSX configuration that syncs to both primary and secondary.

active-gateway.description: Active gateway config for active-active routing.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
items.description: List of active gateway IPv4 addresses.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
items.description: List of active gateway IPv6 addresses.

mac-address-v4.description:
virtual gateway MAC address for the corresponding ipv4-address.
If active gateway MAC is not configured, the device system MAC will be used as the
gateway MAC

extended-mac-address-v4.description:
Configure the active gateway MAC as the extended MAC. The extended mac stores
addresses in a supplemental table to allow configuring more than the supported
16 virtual MAC addresses.

mac-address-v6.description:
virtual gateway MAC address for the corresponding ipv6-address.
If active gateway MAC is not configured, the device system MAC will be used as the
gateway MAC

extended-mac-address-v6.description:
Configure the active gateway MAC as the extended MAC. The extended mac stores
addresses in a supplemental table to allow configuring more than the supported
16 virtual MAC addresses.

virtual-gw-l3-src-mac-enable.description:
Enables the interface to use the virtual gateway MAC address as the
source MAC for routed traffic.

ipv4-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
ipv4-address.description: IPv4 address configuration on an interface.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
items.description: Secondary IPv4 address configuration on an interface.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).
items.description: IPv6 address configuration on an interface.

autoconfig.description: Enable Automatic IPv6 address configuration on an interface.

link-local.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
link-local.description: IPv6 Link Local Address configuration on an interface.

enable-default-link-local.description: Enable default IPv6 Link Local Address on an interface.

ArubaVsx_Vlan.description: List of vlans to be created on both primary and secondary for ISL, MCLAG and SVI active gateway

l3-vlans.description: List of VLANs to be created on both primary and secondary.

id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

active-forwarding.description:
Determines whether this port has VSX active-forwarding enabled or not.
This should be set on Upstream SVIs only and not on downstream SVIs
that have active-gateway enabled. Active forwarding cannot be enabled on
an interface in which active gateway is configured.

shutdown-on-split.description:
Configures non-vsx interface to go down along with VSX interfaces during split.
This also configures the interface-vlan, whose vlan tag is not configured
on any of the MCLAGs, to go down on VSX split. In case of interface-vlans,
this command is recommended to be configured on those interface-vlans which
would establish L3 adjacency with other devices that are not
part of VSX MCLAGs but part of ISL and that would require immediate reconvergence
on VSX split.For example, VxLAN tunnels formed through VSX switches whose overlay routes
are advertised through these interface-vlans can be configured with this command.

ArubaVsx_VlanDevice.description: List of vlans to be created on both primary and secondary for ISL, MCLAG and SVI active gateway

vlan-interface.description: VLAN to be created on both primary and secondary.

vlan-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

existing-vlan-ip.description: Determines whether this is an existing vlan interface ip.

active-forwarding.description:
Determines whether this port has VSX active-forwarding enabled or not.
This should be set on Upstream SVIs only and not on downstream SVIs
that have active-gateway enabled. Active forwarding cannot be enabled on
an interface in which active gateway is configured.

interface-mode.description: Interface access or trunk mode for VLANs

native-vlan.description:
Native VLAN id for untagged frames arriving on
a trunk interface.  Tagged frames sent on an interface
configured with a native VLAN should have their tags
stripped prior to transmission. This configuration is only
valid on a trunk interface.

tag.description:
This configuration is to make sure that an interface does not accept
untagged frames coming in and configured to be tagged on all VLANs

access-vlan.description: Assign the access VLAN to the access port.

trunk-vlan-all.description: Allow all vlans for trunk mode interface

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description: VLANs that the interface may carry when in trunk mode.

items.x-typeDescription:
VLANs or only single-tagged VLANs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid VLAN IDs
(1 <= vlan-id <= 4094). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any VLAN-ID matching x <= VLAN-ID <= y falls within
the range.
items.description: VLAN ranges that the interface may carry when in trunk mode.

ArubaVsx_PortChannel.description: Grouping for the Port Channel (Aggregate) Interfaces.

port-channel-interface.description: Port channel Interface name and its configuration.

description.description: Description of the port channel Interface.

x-enumDescriptions.TRUNK: Manual static trunk that does not use LACP protocol.
x-enumDescriptions.MULTI_CHASSIS_STATIC: Static multi-chassis LAG which does not use LACP

items.description: Attach physical interfaces to tunnel interface.

linkup-delay-timer-exclude.description:
Disable linkup delay timer on this multichassis port channel interface.
This delays bringing downstream multi-chassis links up, following  VSX device
reboot or ISL flap

x-enumDescriptions.AUTO: Auto detect LACP PDU to determine if LACP passive should be enabled or NOT.

lacp-mode.x-typeDescription: LACP mode for the group id.
lacp-mode.description: Active/Passive mode of LACP for this group

existing-portchannel-ip.description: Determines whether this is an existing portchannel interface IP.

shutdown-on-split.description: Determines whether the port will be shutdown when VSX split occurs.

x-enumDescriptions.ENABLE: Track all client IP addresses on this port.
x-enumDescriptions.DISABLE: Client IP addresses are not tracked on this port.
x-enumDescriptions.AUTO:
Default mode. Track limited set of clients based on LLDP/CDP
signature and access/trunk configuration.

cipt-mode.x-typeDescription: Specifies the client IP tracking mode of the port on AOS-CX switches.
cipt-mode.description: The client IP tracking mode of the port on AOS-CX switches.

cipt-client-limit-max.description: Configure the maximum number of clients tracked on this port.

cipt-update-interval.description: Configure the IP address update interval in seconds.

physical-interface.description:
Name of the physical interface to be used as interswitch link.
Only one port can be configured to act as ISL. Once a port is configured
as an ISL, it will become part of all vlan in system.

portchannel-interface.description:
Name of the portchannel interface to be used as interswitch link.
Only one port can be configured to act as ISL. Once a port is configured
as an ISL, it will become part of all vlan in system.

shutdown-on-split.description:
Determines whether the port will be shutdown when VSX split occurs.
This is only applicable to the ports that are not configured as MCLAG
and SVIs that do not have any MCLAGs as members.

existing-ethernet-ip.description: Determines whether this is an existing ethernet interface IP configuration.

existing-loopback-ip.description: Determines whether this is an existing loopback interface.

vrf-name.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.

existing-vrf.description: Determines whether this is an existing VRF.

existing-management-ip.description: Determines whether this is an existing ethernet interface IP configuration.

ArubaVsx_VsxSyncFeatures.description: VSX sync configuration grouping, this gets applied to both primary and secondary

inter-switch-link-timers.description: Inter-Switch-Link timer configuration common to primary and secondary.

keepalive.description: Keepalive timer configuration common to primary and secondary configuration

ArubaVsx_VsxDeviceCommon.description: VSX device config for primary and secondary

hostname.description: The hostname is used as default prompt for VSX primary and secondary device.

device-serial.description: Serial number of the device being configured for VSX

keepalive-type.description:
Specifies the type of keepalive being configured.
For keepalive type KA_UPSTREAM, Provide source and peer IPs.
For keepalive type KA_ETHERNET, provide the ethernet-interface container details and ethernet-ifname.
For keepalive type KA_LOOPBACK, provide loopback-interface container details and loopback-id.
For keepalive type KA_MGMT, provide management-interface container details.
For keepalive type KA_PORTCHANNEL, provide port-channel-interface container and portchannel-ifname.
For keepalive type KA_SVI, provide vlan-interface container and vlan-id.

x-enumDescriptions.UNKNOWN:
An unknown or unspecified version of the Internet
protocol.
x-enumDescriptions.IPV4: The IPv4 protocol as defined in RFC 791.
x-enumDescriptions.IPV6: The IPv6 protocol as defined in RFC 2460.

keepalive-version.x-typeDescription:
This value represents the version of the IP protocol.
Note that integer representation of the enumerated values
are not specified, and are not required to follow the
InetVersion textual convention in SMIv2.
keepalive-version.description: IPv4/IPv6 keepalive version as IPv4 or IPv6.

vrf.description:
VRF name to be used for keepalive routing. If not configured, then the default
vrf is used.

ArubaVsxCommon_IslTimers.description: VSX ISL timer configuration grouping, applicable to both primary and secondary

hold-time.description:
Inter-switch link hold time interval.
Port is treated as down only when it stays down for the configured hold-time interval.

dead-interval.description:
Inter-switch link dead interval. The dead interval is the amount of time to wait for
hellos from peer before declaring the peer to be missing. Lesser dead-intervals might cause
ISL flap due to dead-interval expiry during scenarios like redundancy switchover.

peer-detect-interval.description:
Inter-switch link peer detect interval. This is the amount of time in seconds that the
device will wait for inter-switch-link interface to link up after a reboot. If the ISL link
does not come up within this time window, the device will declare itself as split from its peer.

ArubaVsxCommon_KeepaliveTimers.description: VSX keepalive timer configuration grouping, applicable to both primary and secondary

udp-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
udp-port.description:
UDP port number of peer device. Default is 7678 for CX and the default for PVOS is 1024.
1024-49151 is the supported range for PVOS.

dead-interval.description:
Keepalive dead time interval. Default is 3 seconds for CX, 5 seconds for PVOS.
3-20 is the supported range for PVOS.

hello-interval.description:
Keepalive hello time interval in seconds fox CX and in milliseconds for PVOS.
Default is 1 second for CX, 1000 milliseconds for PVOS.
400-10000 in milliseconds is the supported range for PVOS.

ArubaVsxCommon_KeepaliveIp.description: VSX keepalive IP configuration grouping, applicable to both primary and secondary

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

source-ip.description:
IPv4/IPv6 address of the device. If not configured, keepalive functionality is
disabled. Configure this if keepalive_type is KA_UPSTREAM.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

peer-ip.description:
IPv4/IPv6 address of the peer device. For PVOS, only IPv4 is supported.
If not configured, keepalive functionality is disabled.
Configure this if keepalive_type is KA_UPSTREAM.

ethernet-ifname.description: Ethernet Interface name for which the keepalive is configured.

loopback-id.description: Loopback Interface ID for which the keepalive is configured.

vlan-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
vlan-id.description: Vlan Interface id for which the keepalive is configured.

portchannel-ifname.description: Port channel Interface name for which the keepalive is configured.

if-mgmt.description: Management interface name configured as keepalive.

ArubaVsxCommon_VsxCommon.description: VSX common configuration grouping, applicable to both primary and secondary

system-mac.description:
System MAC address to be used by L2 control plane protocols.
A pair of VSX switches must have the same system MAC.
If system MAC is not configured, L2 control plane protocols
will use the VSX Primary device MAC address as their
Bridge Identifier. MAC address will be in
[0-9a-fA-F]{2}(:[0-9a-fA-F]{2}){5} format.

split-recovery-disable.description:
Disables split brain recovery.
By default, split-recovery mode is enabled. When ISL goes out-of-sync and if
Keep-alive is established then secondary vsx lags will be brought down.
Subsequently if Keep-alive also fails it causes split condition. In this case
if split-recovery mode is enabled secondary will make its vsx lags up else
secondary will continue to keep its vsx lags down.

linkup-delay-timer.description:
Number of seconds that multi-chassis LAGs should be held down after the ISL is
considered to be fully established and VSX switches are synchronized. Comes into
effect on new ISL deployments, ISL flaps or full device reboot.

role.description:
Specifies whether the device will act as primary or secondary for VSX.
VSX operation requires one peer switch to be primary and the other secondary.
If not configured, then the device will not participate in VSX role election.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
